required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Multi-center, International Prospective Follow up Study
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-center, International Prospective Follow up Study to Assess the Safety and Efficacy of the iTind Procedure After Three to Five Years of Follow Up

brief_summary.textblock: The study objective is to assess the safety and efficacy of iTind three to five years following treatment.

detailed_description.textblock: This study will recruit patients who participated in the MT-03 study in the iTind arm to assess the safety and efficacy of the iTind procedure at three to five years following treatment as demonstrated by reduction of symptoms measured by IPSS and QoL and improvement of functional parameters as measured by peak urinary flow and PVR. Sexual and erectile function will also be assessed alongside the incidence of any related late occurring adverse events.

primary_outcome.description: The primary endpoint of the study is time to first alternative surgical BPH intervention, defined as the time (in months) from the iTind procedure to intervention.
The primary endpoint of the study is time to first alternative surgical BPH intervention, defined as the time (in months) from the iTind procedure to intervention.
The primary endpoint of the study is time to first alternative surgical BPH intervention, defined as the time (in months) from the iTind procedure to intervention.

secondary_outcome.description: Safety will be assessed by the rate of complications attributed to iTind since the last recorded follow up from MT-03 study
Safety will be assessed by the rate of complications attributed to iTind since the last recorded follow up from MT-03 study
Safety will be assessed by the rate of complications attributed to iTind since the last recorded follow up from MT-03 study

arm_group.description: Patient who participated previously in the MT-03 study in the iTind arm

intervention.intervention_name: Review of medical history, administration of questionnaires, uroflowmetry and PVR as measured by ultrasound
intervention.description: Administration of questionnaires to assess patient LUTS, quality of life, sexual behavior and erectile function, in addition to performing PVR and uroflow tests.

study_pop.textblock: Any patient who participated in the MT-03 study in the iTind arm who had not undergone an alternative procedure for BPH during the first 12 month follow-up period and who is willing to participate in the current follow up study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Subject signed informed consent form (ICF)
2. Subject who had participated in the MT-03 study in the iTind arm
3. Subject able to comply with the study protocol.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Any anatomical or physiological condition that in the opinion of the investigator likely to impede successful completion of the study
2. Patients that are known to have had undergone an alternative surgical procedure for BPH during MT-03 study.
